predictions.text: CISA will add at least 2 new CVEs affecting Microsoft Windows and/or Office to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if CISA’s public KEV Catalog shows ≥2 CVE entries with an “Added” date between 2026-02-12 and 2026-03-31 inclusive, where the affected product is Microsoft Windows and/or Microsoft Office. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: CISA KEV catalog daily diffs (new CVEs added)
Microsoft MSRC advisories referencing active exploitation
Major DFIR/vendor writeups confirming in-the-wild exploitation
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting highlighted active exploitation; CISA often adds widely exploited Microsoft issues to KEV quickly when impact is broad.

predictions.text: The U.S. Senate will hold at least one roll-call vote on legislation or a joint resolution aimed at terminating, blocking, or disapproving U.S. tariffs specifically described as “Canada tariffs” (or equivalent) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Senate.gov or Congress.gov records a roll-call vote (Yea/Nay roll call) on a bill or joint resolution whose purpose section/title/summary explicitly targets termination/disapproval of tariffs on Canada (or Canada-origin goods) by the deadline. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov actions on tariff-related resolutions (e.g., CRA, trade measures)
Senate calendar/whip notices mentioning Canada tariffs
Statements from Senate Finance Committee leadership
predictions.rationale: House action increases the odds of Senate consideration, but floor time and party discipline keep probability below 50%.

predictions.text: U.S. Customs Duties ("Customs and Certain Excise Taxes") receipts will be reported at or above $12.0 billion for at least one month in the U.S. Treasury Monthly Treasury Statement (MTS) released by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if any MTS released by the deadline reports Customs Duties receipts (monthly amount) ≥ $12.0B. False if no such month occurs in releases by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Monthly Treasury Statement tables (receipts line items)
Announcements of new/expanded tariff schedules or enforcement intensity
Import volume trends and customs collection lags
predictions.rationale: With reported tariff revenue surging, a ≥$12B month is plausible if elevated tariff rates/collections persist through mid-2026.

predictions.text: The FAA will publish a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) or equivalent formal Federal Register proposal that explicitly addresses counter-UAS (counter-drone) operations, equipment authorization, or airport-area mitigation authority for civilian airports by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if the Federal Register contains an FAA NPRM (or interim final rule/proposed policy with request for comment) by the deadline that explicitly includes counter-UAS/counter-drone operations or mitigation near/for civilian airports in its scope/summary. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: FAA Unified Agenda / regulatory plan entries on UAS/counter-UAS
Airport/airline lobbying activity and DHS/DOJ counter-UAS authority updates
NOTAM spikes or major airport disruptions attributed to drones
predictions.rationale: High-profile disruptions increase pressure for formal rulemaking, but statutory constraints and interagency jurisdiction make timing uncertain.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense will award at least one electricity procurement contract (new award or major modification) with an obligated value of at least $50 million that explicitly references electricity generated from coal-fired power (or coal plants) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a contract award/modification in SAM.gov, FPDS, or DoD procurement releases by the deadline shows obligated value ≥$50M and the description/requirements explicitly mention coal-fired generation/coal plants as the electricity source. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: SAM.gov solicitations mentioning coal generation requirements
DoD energy procurement policy memos implementing the order
Congressional/DOD IG scrutiny of procurement sourcing language
predictions.rationale: An executive order signals intent, but translating intent into large explicit coal-linked contract language may face procurement, cost, and policy hurdles.

predictions.text: Cisco will announce a workforce reduction affecting at least 3,000 employees (globally) in a press release, earnings materials, or SEC filing by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Cisco publicly discloses layoffs/job cuts (or restructuring plan) with headcount impact ≥3,000 employees by the deadline in an SEC filing (8-K/10-Q/10-K) or official press release/earnings deck. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: Cisco guidance revisions and restructuring-charge disclosures
Job posting trends and WARN notices in key locations
Management commentary about cost actions and margin targets
predictions.rationale: Weaker outlook raises probability of cost actions, but the size threshold is meaningful and not guaranteed.

predictions.text: Meta Platforms will disclose an additional share repurchase authorization of at least $50 billion (incremental authorization, not merely ongoing buybacks) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Meta discloses (earnings release, 8-K, 10-Q/10-K, or investor presentation) a new incremental authorization amount ≥$50B by the deadline. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: Meta quarterly capital return disclosures (buyback authorization remaining vs new)
Cash flow and capex guidance trends
Activist/institutional commentary on capital return
predictions.rationale: Strong cash generation and valuation narratives make a large incremental authorization plausible, though AI capex could compete for funds.

predictions.text: USD/JPY will trade at or below 130.00 at least once (spot intraday) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a widely used reference data source (e.g., Bloomberg/Refinitiv/ICE or major FX venue prints) shows USD/JPY spot intraday low ≤130.00 on any trading day by the deadline. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: BoJ policy shifts (yield curve, rates) and MoF FX intervention rhetoric
US-Japan rate differential moves and Fed cut expectations
Risk-off episodes boosting yen demand
predictions.rationale: A fragile equity rally and rate-differential compression could strengthen JPY, but reaching 130 requires a substantial move, keeping confidence modest.

predictions.text: OpenAI will publicly announce either (a) a new dedicated safety/alignment organizational unit (team or division) or (b) a formal external safety oversight body (board/advisory council) with a defined charter, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if OpenAI publishes an official announcement (blog post/press release) by the deadline describing creation of a new safety/alignment unit or external oversight body, naming it and stating responsibilities/charter. False otherwise.
monitoring_signals: OpenAI governance announcements (board/committees), safety policy updates
Major partner/regulator pressure (EU, US agencies) tied to safety commitments
Hiring spikes for safety, evals, and policy roles
predictions.rationale: Disbanding an alignment team can trigger reputational/regulatory pressure; a structured replacement is plausible but not assured within this timeframe.
